2018-12-04.weather-summary: Light snow (< 1 in.) on Monday and next Tuesday, with high temperatures falling to 35°F on Saturday.

news.title: C.I.A. Briefing on Khashoggi Solidifies Senators’ View of Prince Mohammed’s Complicity
news.abstract: “There is not a smoking gun, there’s a smoking saw,” Senator Lindsey Graham said after a briefing by the C.I.A. director, Gina Haspel.
news.image-caption: Gina Haspel, the director of the C.I.A., briefed senators on the killing of Jamal Khashoggi on Tuesday.

news.title: Trump to Meet With Kim Jong-un, Despite North Korea’s Lapses, Bolton Says
news.abstract: John R. Bolton, the national security adviser, said the North’s lack of progress on ending its nuclear program left room for a new meeting, likely in early 2019, to be productive.
news.image-caption: President Trump and the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, at their summit meeting in Singapore in June. A second meeting is likely in January or February, said John R. Bolton, the national security adviser.

news.title: Pompeo Questions the Value of International Groups Like U.N. and E.U.
news.abstract: Speaking in Brussels, the secretary of state said that some institutions fail to serve their member nations, and should be revised or eliminated.

news.title: Stocks Slide After Trump Tweets on Trade, While Bond Market Sounds Recession Warning
news.abstract: The yield curve — the difference between the interest rates on short- and long-term Treasury bonds — is at its narrowest level since 2007, in what some see as an ominous sign for the economy.

news.title: Trump, Self-Styled ‘Tariff Man,’ Issues China a Warning
news.abstract: Giving himself the nickname on Twitter, the president said he would impose additional tariffs if China did not live up to promises made on the G-20 sidelines.

news.title: Trump Offers German Automakers a Pause on Car Tariffs, for Now
news.abstract: A hastily organized White House meeting came as fears were rising in Europe that the president may follow through on threats to impose car tariffs.
news.image-caption: A BMW factory in Greer, S.C., produces about 1,400 vehicles a day.

news.title: Wisconsin Legislature Live Updates: A Fight Over Governor’s Power
news.abstract: After losing top state offices, Republican lawmakers are racing to pass legislation that would diminish the power of the incoming Democratic governor.

2018-12-05.weather-summary: No precipitation throughout the week, with high temperatures rising to 42°F next Wednesday.

news.title: George H.W. Bush Funeral Live: A Son Eulogizes His Father
news.abstract: The United States’ five living presidents and about a dozen current and former heads of state are at the National Cathedral for a state funeral.

news.title: National Day of Mourning for Bush: What It Means and What’s Closed
news.abstract: The federal government on Wednesday marked a “National Day of Mourning” for President George Bush, who died last week, leaving the Postal Service and the Supreme Court closed.
news.image-caption: President Trump declared Wednesday a “National Day of Mourning” for President George H.W. Bush, who died last week.

news.title: ‘A Mixture of Sad and Joyful’: The Old Bush Gang Gathers for a Final Send-Off
news.abstract: On the eve of the state funeral for former President George Bush, the men and women who helped him run the nation gathered in Washington for reunion of sorts.
news.image-caption: Dick Cheney, Mr. Bush’s defense secretary, and James Baker, Mr. Bush’s secretary of state, at a ceremony on Monday honoring him at the Capitol.

news.title: For George Bush and His Eldest Son, a Relationship Unique Among American Presidents
news.abstract: In retirement, the 41st and 43rd presidents could finally focus on the things that parents and children focus on when the parent grows older.
news.image-caption: Mr. Bush pinned a lieutenant bar on his son George W. Bush when he was made an officer in the Texas Air National Guard in 1968.

news.title: George Bush’s Legacy: Revisiting Past Claims
news.abstract: As the nation remembers the former president, we assess some popular anecdotes about him, including his reaction to a grocery store scanner and whether Ross Perot cost him a second term.
news.image-caption: A visit President George Bush made to the National Grocers Association convention in Florida during the 1992 campaign cemented the impression that he was detached from middle-class life.

news.title: Wisconsin Republicans Approve Bills Stripping Power From Incoming Democratic Governor
news.abstract: The legislation, which Democrats vehemently opposed and protesters chanted their anger over, passed through the Republican-held State Legislature on Wednesday.
news.image-caption: Protesters at the State Capitol opposed Republican legislation that would diminish the power of the incoming Democratic governor and attorney general.

news.title: Les Moonves Obstructed Investigation Into Misconduct Claims, Report Says
news.abstract: Leslie Moonves, the former CBS chief, destroyed evidence and misled investigators looking into his alleged misconduct, according to a draft of a report prepared for the company’s board.
news.image-caption: Leslie Moonves stepped down as the chief executive of CBS in September after more than a dozen women, including a doctor, accused him of sexual misconduct.
